title: Is This The End?
historical_context: This article reflects the challenges faced by independent zine publishers in the early 90s, a time when BBS culture was thriving but also demanding.
target_audience: Hackers, zine enthusiasts, and those interested in the evolution of hacker culture.
short_summary: The author expresses fatigue and pressure from managing the magazine alone, hinting at the potential end of the publication unless contributors step forward.
summary: Hellraiser's message serves as a poignant reminder of the challenges faced by independent creators in the hacker community. The zine culture of the early 90s was vibrant, yet it relied heavily on the dedication of individuals like Hellraiser, who often found themselves overwhelmed. His plea for help not only highlights the personal struggles behind the scenes but also reflects the communal spirit that is essential for the survival of such grassroots publications. As he hints at the possibility of discontinuation, readers are left to ponder the importance of community support in sustaining the voices of hacker culture.
